intro: Grazielia mollissima, commonly known as the silky grazielia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
